com.buabook.kdb.publisher

Class KdbPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.buabook.kdb.connection.KdbConnection
      • com.buabook.kdb.publisher.KdbPublisher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class KdbPublisher
extends KdbConnection

    KDB Data Publisher

    Provides the ability to publish some data (in either KdbTable or c.Flip format) to a specific kdb process.

    Any instantiation of this class will cause the publisher to run in the current thread. Use KdbPublisherThread if you need a new thread.

    (c) 2014 - 2015 Sport Trades Ltd
    Since:
    6 Apr 2014
    Version:
    1.1.0
    Author:
    Jas Rajasansir

      • resetConnectionDuration

        private final org.joda.time.Duration resetConnectionDuration

        The maximum amount of time after the last publish / connect allowed before the connection to the kdb process is reset. This is due to socket timeout on the target machine that may not be noticed by the local Java process.

        On Linux boxes, /proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_keepalive_time will tell you how long a socket can stay open.

      • lastPublishTime

        private org.joda.time.DateTime lastPublishTime
        The time of the last successful publish to the kdb process

      • KdbPublisher

        public KdbPublisher(KdbProcess server,
                    org.joda.time.Duration resetConnectionDuration)
             throws KdbTargetProcessUnavailableException
        Generates a new KDB publisher. NOTE: The process must be online and available to connect to when this constructor is called; reconnection is not supported here.
        Parameters:
        server - The server to connect to
        resetConnectionDuration - The maximum time allowed between publishes before the connection is reset. If this is null, DEFAULT_RESET_CONNECTION_DURATION will be used
        Throws:
        KdbTargetProcessUnavailableException - If the target KDB process is unavailable
        See Also:
        KdbConnection.connect(), resetConnectionDuration

        Returns:
        The publish status for each table in the list

      • publish

        public Boolean publish(KdbTable table)
        Allows a table (as an internal KdbTable to be published to the target KDB process
        Parameters:
        table - The table to publish
        Returns:
        true if the publish was successful, false otherwise
        See Also:

      • publish

        public Boolean publish(String tableName,
                       c.Flip tableData)
        Performs the publish of a c.Flip table structure to the target KDB process
        Parameters:
        tableName - The name of the table to publish
        tableData - The table contents
        Returns:
        true if the publish was successful, false otherwise. NOTE: The function will also return true if either parameter is null
